tools

Class IndexedNeighborGraphTool

  • java.lang.Object
    • tools.IndexedNeighborGraphTool

  • public class IndexedNeighborGraphTool
extends java.lang.Object
    This class contains tools, in the form of static methods, that enable one to save a (typically sparse) IndexedNeighborGraph to a text file. The graph is saved in the form of a sparse adjacency matrix. The file produced consists of a list of rows of triplets of integers corresponding to the nonzero entries of the adjacency matrix. More specifically, the first two entries in a row consist of the indices corresponding to a pair of neighboring vertices. The third entry of each row is a 1, corresponding the value of the matrix entry at that index pair. The rows in the list are ordered lexicographically.

    In this format, the adjacency matrix of the graph can be loaded into any software (e.g. MATLAB) that deals with sparse matrices.

    In addition, there is also the capability of saving a list of String representations of the vertex elements, ordered according to the indexing. The method createIndexedElementsFile, which performs this action, requires an implementation of the StringConverter interface for translating the vertex elements to Strings.

    Author:
    pdokos

      static interface  IndexedNeighborGraphTool.StringConverter
      A helper interface for translating vertex elements of a graph to Strings.

    • Method Detail

      • createSparseMatrixFile

        public static <T> boolean createSparseMatrixFile(IndexedNeighborGraph<T> graph,
                                 java.io.File sparseMatrixFile)
        This method writes the given IndexedNeighborGraph to the given file, in the form of a sparse adjacency matrix. The file produced consists of a list of rows of triplets of integers corresponding to the nonzero entries of the adjacency matrix. More specifically, the first two entries in a row consist of the indices corresponding to a pair of neighboring vertices. The third entry of each row is a 1, corresponding to the value of the matrix entry at that index pair. The rows in the list are ordered lexicographically.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The vertex type on which the graph structure is defined.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph being written to file.
        sparseMatrixFile - The file to which the graph is written.
        Returns:
        true if the graph was successfully written to file.

      • createIndexedElementsFile

        public static <T> boolean createIndexedElementsFile(IndexedNeighborGraph<T> graph,
                                    java.io.File indexedElementsFile,
                                    java.lang.String eltsFileHeader,
                                    IndexedNeighborGraphTool.StringConverter strConverter)
        This method writes a list of String representations of the vertices of the given graph to the given file, using the given StringConvertor as a translation mechanism. The String representations are separated by newline characters, and ordered according to the indexing on the vertex set.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The vertex type on which the graph structure is defined.
        Parameters:
        graph - The graph whose vertex set is being written to file.
        indexedElementsFile - The file to which the String representations of the vertices are written.
        eltsFileHeader - A header String as the first line of the file. The null reference may be passed to produce a file without a header.
        strConverter - A StringConverter implementation that translates objects of type T to Strings.
        Returns:
        true if the list of vertices of the graph was successfully written to file.

      • createIndexedSparseMatrixFiles

        public static <T> boolean createIndexedSparseMatrixFiles(IndexedNeighborGraph<T> graph,
                                         java.io.File sparseMatrixFile,
                                         java.io.File indexedElementsFile,
                                         java.lang.String eltsFileHeader,
                                         IndexedNeighborGraphTool.StringConverter strConverter)
